Question: The decline in this person's reputation has been attributed partly to the revival of feminism.
Hints: Adolf Grünbaum has maintained, in opposition to Popper, that many of this person's theories are empirically testable.
From 1909, Adler's views on topics such as neurosis began to differ markedly from those held by this person.
In February 1923, this person detected a leukoplakia, a benign growth associated with heavy smoking, on his mouth.
